name: Multiplying and dividing with mixed number fractions

skills.name: Multiply mixed number fractions in the form: Fraction × Integer
Multiply mixed number fraction in the form: Fraction × Fraction
Divide mixed number fractions in the form: Fraction ÷ Integer
Divide mixed number fraction in the form: Integer ÷ Fraction
Divide mixed number fraction in the form: Fraction ÷ Fraction

explanations.A: For this calculation we have to multiply both the 1 and 2/3 by 2. 1 x 2 = 2 and 2/3 x 2 = 4/3 = 1 1/3. If we add together our two results: 2 + 1 1/3 = 3 1/3 which is option A.
explanations.B: I think you have accidentally forgotten to multiply the 2/3 by 2 as well.
explanations.C: I think you have forgotten to multiply the integer by 2 as well. When you have done this add this answer to the 4/3 but first convert 4/3 into a mixed number, to make the addition easier to do.
explanations.D: I think you have accidentally multiplied the denominator of the fraction by 2, as well as the numerator. 4/6 = 2/3 not 2 x 2/3. 2 written as a fraction is 2/1 if we multiply this by 2/3, what would we get?

explanations.A: I think you have accidentally multiplied the denominator of the fraction by 2, as well as the numerator. 6/10 = 3/5 not 2 x 3/5. 2 written as a fraction is 2/1 if we multiply this by 3/5, what would we get?
explanations.B: I think you have accidentally forgotten to multiply the 3/5 by 2 as well.
explanations.C: I think you have forgotten to multiply the integer by 2 as well. When you have done this add this answer to the 6/5 but first convert 6/5 into a mixed number, to make the addition easier to do.
explanations.D: For this calculation we have to multiply both the 1 and 3/5 by 2. 1 x 2 = 2 and 3/5 x 2 = 6/5 = 1 1/5. If we add together our two results: 2 + 1 1/5 = 3 1/5 which is option D.

explanations.A: I think you have just multiplied the 1 and 2 together however we need to multiply the 1 by 3/4, the 2/3 by 2 and the 2/3 by 3/4 as well, then add all these together to get the final answer.
explanations.B: I think you have accidentally added the whole numbers together to get 3. The sum is a multiplication sum and we need to make sure we multiply everything in the first mixed number by everything in the second. This means multiplying 1 by 2 and 3/4 & 2/3 by 2 and 3/4 as well. Once you have all these, add them together to get the final answer.
explanations.C: Turning these into improper fractions we have 5/3 x 11/4 = 55/12. Writing this as a mixed number again we have 4 7/12
explanations.D: I think you have multiplied the fractions brilliantly but have made an error in the simplifying step of the calculation. Make sure you have correctly counted the number of 12s in your numerator. If you guessed: turn all the mixed numbers into improper fractions, multiply the numerators and the denominators of these, then convert the answer back into a mixed number.

explanations.A: I think you have just multiplied the 1 and 3 together however we need to multiply the 1 by 2/3, the 1/2 by 3 and the 1/2 by 2/3 as well, then add all these together to get the final answer.
explanations.B: I think you have multiplied the fractions brilliantly but have made an error in the simplifying step of the calculation. Make sure you have correctly counted the number of 6s in your numerator. If you guessed: turn all the mixed numbers into improper fractions, multiply the numerators and the denominators of these, then convert the answer back into a mixed number.
explanations.C: I think you have accidentally added the whole numbers together to get 4. The sum is a multiplication sum and we need to make sure we multiply everything in the first mixed number by everything in the second. This means multiplying 1 by 3 and 2/3 & the 1/2 by 3 and 2/3 as well. Once you have all these, add them together to get the final answer.
explanations.D: Writing these as improper fractions we have 3/2 x 11/3 = 33/6. Writing this as a mixed number we have 5 3/6

explanations.A: Each part of the mixed number needs to be divided by 2... 2 ÷ 2 = 1 and 2/3 ÷ 2 = 1/3 so the final answer is 1 1/3.
explanations.B: I think you have accidentally forgotten to divide the fractional part, of the mixed number, by 2 as well.
explanations.C: I think you have accidentally forgotten to divide the integer by 2 as well.
explanations.D: I think you have accidentally done the calculation the wrong way round, you have done 2 ÷ 2 2/3 rather than 2 2/3 ÷ 2.

explanations.A: I think you have accidentally forgotten to divide the fractional part, of the mixed number, by 4 as well.
explanations.B: Each part of the mixed number needs to be divided by 4... 8 ÷ 4 = 2 and 4/5 ÷ 4 = 1/5 so the final answer is 2 1/5.
explanations.C: I think you have accidentally forgotten to divide the integer by 4 as well.
explanations.D: I think you have accidentally done the calculation the wrong way round, you have done 4 ÷ 8 4/5 rather than 8 4/5 ÷ 4.

explanations.A: I think you have accidentally done the calculation the wrong way round, you have done 2 2/3 ÷ 2. You need to do 2 ÷ 2 2/3.
explanations.B: I think you have accidentally attempted the sum the wrong way round. Make sure you are doing 2 ÷ 2 2/3. You are asking yourself how many 2 2/3 fit into 2. Can you fit 2 2/3 into 2? What does this mean our answer will be then?
explanations.C: I think you have accidentally attempted the sum the wrong way round. Make sure you are doing 2 ÷ 2 2/3. You are asking yourself how many 2 2/3 fit into 2. Can you fit 2 2/3 into 2? What does this mean our answer will be then?
explanations.D: This calculation can be completed in many ways. The sum is asking how many 2 2/3 are there in 2, as 2 is smaller than 2 2/3 the answer must be less than 1. The only option that is less than 1 is D. Working through the mathematics to get the answer, we would convert 2 2/3 to an improper fraction: 8/3 and then multiply 2 by the reciprocal of 8/3 as dividing by a fraction is the same as multiplying by its reciprocal. 2/1 x 3/8 = 6/8 = 3/4.

explanations.A: Start by converting the mixed number into an improper fraction 2 4/5 = 14/5 and 4 as a fraction is 4/1. Dividing by a fraction is the same as multiplying by the reciprocal. For example if you divide by 1/2 that is the same as multiplying by 2. In this calcualtion we are dividing by 14/5 so that is the same as multiplying by 5/14. 4/1 x 5/14 = 20/14. There is one 14 in 20 with 6 left over so 20/14 = 1 6/14 = 1 3/7.
explanations.B: I think you have accidentally divided 4/5 by 4 to get 1/5. We need to perform the calculation the other way round and include the wholes. Start by converting 4 into a fraction. Next, convert the mixed number to an improper fraction. Dividing by a fraction is the same as multiplying by its reciprocal so find the reciprocal of this value and multiply the two fractions together. You will then need to convert this improper fraction back into a mixed number.
explanations.C: I think you have accidentally divided 2 4/5 by 2, you need to do 4 ÷ 2 4/5. If you are struggling, follow these steps: start by converting 4 into a fraction. Next, convert the mixed number to an improper fraction. Dividing by a fraction is the same as multiplying by its reciprocal so find the reciprocal of this value and multiply the two fractions together. You will then need to convert this improper fraction back into a mixed number.
explanations.D: I think you have accidentally done the calculation the wrong way round, you have done 2 4/5 ÷ 4. You need to do 4 ÷ 2 4/5.

explanations.A: I think you have accidentally added the denominators. What you need to do is convert the mixed numbers into improper fractions. When dividing by a fraction in maths, it's the same as multiplying by the reciprocal. For example dividing by 1/2 is the same as multiplying by 2 (2/1). So you need to multiply the first fraction by the reciprocal of the second fraction. Once you have this answer, convert it into a mixed number to work out the ★.
explanations.B: I think you have accidentally multiplied the denominators. What you need to do is convert the mixed numbers into improper fractions. When dividing by a fraction in maths, it's the same as multiplying by the reciprocal. So you need to multiply the first fraction by the reciprocal of the second fraction. Once you have this answer, convert it into a mixed number to work out the ★.
explanations.C: First convert the mixed numbers into improper fractions 1 1/2 = 3/2 and 1 1/3 = 4/3. Then, as dividing by a fraction is the same as multiplying by its reciprocal, do the calculation: 3/2 x 3/4 = 9/8. We then need to convert this improper fraction back to a mixed number. There is 1 8 in 9 so 9/8 = 1 1/8. Therefore the ★ is 8.
explanations.D: I think you have correctly converted the mixed numbers into improper fractions but then you have flipped both fractions and multiplied the denominators. You only need to flip the second fraction as dividing is the same as multiplying by the reciprocal.

explanations.A: First convert the mixed numbers into improper fractions 1 1/3 = 4/3 and 1 1/4 = 5/4. Then, as dividing by a fraction is the same as multiplying by its reciprocal, do the calculation: 4/3 x 4/5 = 16/15. We then need to convert this improper fraction back to a mixed number. There is one 15 in 16 so 1 1/15. Therefore the ★ is 15.
explanations.B: I think you have accidentally multiplied the denominators. What you need to do is convert the mixed numbers into improper fractions. When dividing by a fraction in maths, it's the same as multiplying by the reciprocal. So you need to multiply the first fraction by the reciprocal of the second fraction. Once you have this answer, convert it into a mixed number to work out the ★
explanations.C: I think you have correctly converted the mixed numbers into improper fractions but then you have flipped the first fraction and multiplied the denominators. You don't flip the first fraction, you only flip the second fraction as dividing is the same as multiplying by the reciprocal.
explanations.D: I think you have accidentally added the denominators. What you need to do is convert the mixed numbers into improper fractions. When dividing by a fraction in maths, it's the same as multiplying by the reciprocal. So you need to multiply the first fraction by the reciprocal of the second fraction. Once you have this answer, convert it into a mixed number to work out the ★.
